title: 46 Miami Interior Designers on the AD PRO Directory You Need to Know About
description: Searching for Miami interior designers to hire? Look no further than our list of AD-approved talent
author: Dan Howarth, Elizabeth Stamp, Lila Allen
byline: Dan Howarth, Elizabeth Stamp, Lila Allen
excerpt: Searching for Miami interior designers to hire for your next home project? Look no further than our list of AD-approved talent
text: With Magic City in the midst of a real estate boom, it’s no shock that Miami interior designers are currently in such high demand. As buyers flocked to sunny South Florida shores during and following the pandemic lockdowns, prices in the metropolis soared—and the need for designers swiftly followed. Luckily, the city is already home to a wealth of creative talent who can adeptly cater to high-end clientele and know exactly how to design for Miami’s famed tropical climate. Drawing on its rich Art Deco history, myriad Latin American influences, and the latest interiors trends, these AD PRO Directory–listed designers can offer clients elevated beach villas that embrace indoor-outdoor living, sleek minimalist residences in the city’s many starchitect-designed towers, and much more.Love Lake StudioFor the primary bedroom of this Surf Club Four Seasons Residences home in Miami, Love Lake Studio combined unexpected textures such as a custom woven headboard paired with with a baseball stitch leather headboard and floating bedside tables topped with lava stone. Photo by Kris Tamburello / Senses UnleashedWhether designing Miami beach bungalows or Manhattan hotspots, Love Lake Studio knows how to blend a wide range of influences into one-of-a-kind spaces. The Miami-based interior architecture and design studio brings an artful, luxury-filled approach to residential and commercial projects around the world. Led by founder and principal Genevieve Lake, the team’s impactful interiors have garnered them a client list made up entirely of referrals and repeat clients.Rose Ink WorkshopRose Ink Workshop crafted a serene bedroom retreat for a home in Miami Beach featuring custom bed and headboard millwork, a Vladimir Kagan sofa, and a coffee table by Ukrainian designer Victoria Yakusha. Photo by Douglas Friedman; Styling by Anita SardisiDesigner Liubasha Rose earned her stripes designing high-profile hotels and restaurants. She brings this hospitality experience to her Miami Beach– and New York–based firm, Rose Ink Workshop. Rose and her team, who boast backgrounds in art, fashion, interiors, and branding, focus on designing spaces that tell a story. They apply this narrative-driven style to residential and hospitality projects across the globe, from estates on Miami’s exclusive Star Island to country homes in New York.Wecselman DesignThis striking double-height living space by Wecselman Design blends contemporary polish with curated art pieces, like the lucite grand piano, that makes a splashy statement. Photo by Douglas FriedmanAfter a dozen years designing stores for Ralph Lauren, Deborah Wecselman brought together a talented team of architects and designers in founding her eponymous firm in Miami. Now, Wecselman Design specializes in high-end residential interiors, drawing inspiration from a wide variety of sources, including ocean views and sleek art galleries. Neutral palettes allow colorful artwork, architectural elements, and panoramic views to take center stage.Studio 790 Interior DesignThis light-filled kitchen by Studio 790 Interior Design features a statement jade island, striking black Copacabana countertops, and sculptural lighting in a showcase of form and function. Photo by Jackie KnabbenBy mixing vivid colors and eye-catching patterns, Studio 790 Interior Design creates contemporary spaces filled with personality. Founded by Ann Lopez, who brings over 20 years of luxury hospitality design experience, the studio brings fun and functionality to everything from residential projects to large-scale commercial designs. With hundreds of completed spaces under their belts, Lopez and her all-female team work in a wide range of styles, from coastal to boho.Luxury Living by Ania AgárdyIn an oceanfront project in Miami Beach, Luxury Living by Ania Agárdy opted for minimalism. Photo by Pompi GutniskyThrough her design portfolio, Ania Agárdy argues sophistication is about detail. Her Miami interior design firm brings refinement and modern elegance to projects from New York to Latin America. The designer’s multicultural background and world travels influence her high-end yet functional spaces, which feature a mix of styles and decor sourced from across the globe. In addition to residential projects, the firm also lends its expert eye to yacht designs and art curation.Sanchez Coleman StudioFor a home at The Surf Club Miami Beach, Sanchez Coleman Studio used an eye-catching blue ombre wallpaper on the column and furnished the space with curvaceous pieces from Ralph Pucci Miami. Photo by Ken HaydenIn 2017, interior designer Christopher Coleman combined forces with Venezuelan architect and fashion designer Angel Sanchez to form Sanchez Coleman Studio, a combination of their unique perspectives and wealth of experience. Art frequently takes center stage in the high-end firm’s modern designs, and the team doesn’t shy away from old bold elements either. Whether it's with whimsical banana-print wallpaper or dramatic color palettes, the Miami-based firm adds contemporary flair to everything from private residences to hotels to developments.2id InteriorsDramatic black Miacucina cabinets and Nero Marquina stone counters add to the bold look of a kitchen by 2id Interiors. Photo by MCA EstúdioDesign is imbued with particular a sense of comfort and urban ease in the work of 2id Interiors. Led by founders Rafaela Simoes and Laila Colvin, the Miami studio works on residential and commercial projects across South Florida and around the world. Ocean or city views often serve as a focal point in the firm’s spaces, which feature sleek surfaces, sculptural lighting, neutral palettes, and plenty of bespoke details while maintaining a familial vibe.Carolina DesignFor a layered indoor-outdoor living room in Miami, Carolina Design embraced the lush subtropical surroundings. Photo by Jessica GlynnThe work of designer Carolina Freyre teems with old-world inspiration. Her Coral Gables–based firm, Carolina Design, is known for its relaxed yet refined interiors, which range in style from modern farmhouse to Tuscan-inspired. Freyre draws on her background working at the Miami Art Museum to give her spaces a curated feel that invigorates the senses. The designer excels at crafting rooms to delight every member of the family, from charming bunk rooms to captivating closets.Ricardo Barroso and AssociatesA Brickell Key, Miami, penthouse designed by Ricardo Barroso and Associates was inspired by Mediterranean colors and textures, as well as the client’s love of the South of France. Photo by Tim WilliamsWith offices in Miami, Mexico City, and Madrid, Ricardo Barroso and Associates brings a global perspective to its high-end residential, commercial, and hospitality design projects. Founded in 1999 by architect, interior designer, and artist Ricardo Barroso, the international design studio boasts a team of skilled contractors and craftsmen who help execute and elevate their designs. The Miami office works on South Florida homes of all sizes and also brings its polished, luxe aesthetic to yachts.Janet Patterson Interior DesignFor a Miami bachelor who likes to cook and entertain, JPID Studio envisioned a moody yet functional kitchen design that elevates the interiors of the apartment. Photo by Jeanne CantoDesigner Janet Patterson knows how to create interiors that speak to her client and their lifestyles, whether they require a bold bachelor pad or a cozy cottage. Her namesake firm specializes in new construction and large-scale renovations that enhance their owners’ wellbeing. JPID offers full-service interior design, including comprehensive turnkey projects, as well as e-design services for smaller projects and spaces.Errez DesignFor their space in the 2023 Kips Bay Decorator Show House, Errez Design honored the glamour of the Gilded Age and the romance of 19th-century travel, all reimagined through a contemporary lens. Photo by Dan CultronaFounded by Ruben and Katie Gutierrez in 2009, Errez Design brings a big dose of personality to their residential and commercial projects. To this day, the husband-and-wife team are known for fearlessly incorporating vivid colors and dazzling patterns to create a Miami maximalist aesthetic. The firm’s “biographical design” process also ensures that all finished products are functional—and meaningful—for the client. Errez Design has completed 100 projects in Florida and around the world, each showcasing its signature lively, livable style.Design SolutionsLed by founder Luciana Fragali, Miami interiors firm Design Solutions captures the city’s coolness through its elevated residential projects. For over 19 years, the firm has been transforming homes into modern masterpieces with exquisite materials, sculptural furnishings, and blue-chip art. Fragali and her team offer white-glove, turnkey service and call on a trusted roster of vendors and craftspeople to ensure that the end product meets its high standards.Moniomi DesignIn the bathroom of a West New York, New Jersey, home, Moniomi Design created sensorial sanctuary with sculptural floral vases, statement marble, and a scalloped bath tub. Photo by Jeanne CantoUnexpected details and playful elements are through lines in the work of Moniomi Design. Led by husband-and-wife team Ronald Alvarez and Monica Santayana, the firm is known for the fun, eclectic style it incorporates into residential and commercial projects, which range from Upper West Side apartments to Wynwood office spaces. Its product line, Made by Moniomi, includes a creative assortment of furnishings, from Ping-Pong tables to luxe mini basketball hoops.Sensi Casa Design StudioThis open-concept pavilion by Sensi Casa Design Studio combines clean architectural lines with organic material. Photo by Chris CarterNatural materials, soft textures, and neutral palettes lend the interiors by Sensi Casa Design Studio a feeling of tranquility and comfort. Led by Chiara Sensi Contugi and Diego Guarderas, the Pinecrest-based firm partners with clients to transform their homes into showpieces, and also helps with home staging and furniture rentals, as well as collaborating on luxury new builds. Sensi Contugi and Guarderas draw inspiration from their Italian heritage, incorporating nods to old world and contemporary European style.Margarita BravoMargarita Bravo used a floral velvet Arte wallpaper to add a wow factor to a Denver bedroom. Photo by Tahvory BuntingDeftly working across a wide range of styles, from coastal minimalism to contemporary glamour, designer Margarita Bravo helps clients create homes that are personally reflective. Bravo and her team design projects around the world, offering full-service design solutions, space planning, custom furniture design, and art curation from locations in Denver, Miami, Montecito, Aspen, and Barcelona. Drawing inspiration from Latin American and European design, the firm expertly balances livability and beauty in its residential and commercial projects.Marcela Cure StudioIn this Coral Gables home by Marcela Cure Studio, bold silhouettes, curated pieces, and collected art coexist with a serene palette and lush outdoor views—a refined balance of form, function, and feeling. Photo by Mateo SotoDesigner Marcela Cure brings an artist’s eye to her interiors. Operating from Miami, Delaware, and Colombia, Marcela Cure Studio takes a curatorial approach to its residential and boutique commercial interiors in the United States and Latin America, blending sculptural forms with playful punches of personality. The firm’s layered spaces are enhanced by an elegant mix of natural materials, artisanal objects, and custom furnishings, giving each home a one-of-a-kind feel.Poggi DesignElegance meets tranquility in this meticulously crafted penthouse on Fisher Island, Miami Beach. Each piece of custom furniture is designed by Juan Poggi to reflect the owner's discerning taste. Kris TamburelloCreative collaboration is at the heart of Poggi Design’s process. Led by Juan Poggi, the Coral Gables–based firm considers everyone involved in a project—including clients, contractors, and architects—an integral part of the team. The designer finds inspiration in his travels across the globe and brings his discoveries into the modern spaces he creates in Miami and beyond.Poggi Design is particularly adept at devising interiors that showcase spectacular art collections in spaces that feel warm and welcoming. Poggi captures the spirit of each project before he begins designing and creates a unique piece for every home the firm works on. In addition to the firm’s residential work, they offer a collection of sleek seating and lighting.Prime ProjectsThis light-filled living room by Prime Projects in Brooklyn is all about contrast. Stylish silhouettes create a play of light and shadow, adding depth to the space centered around the ’70s vintage Don Chadwick modular sofa. Nick GlimenakisLed by principals Jovanna Joseph and Brendan Mahoney, Prime Projects is known for playing with dramatic contrasts to create memorable spaces, from a burnt orange office kitchen to a high-rise apartment filled with colorful accents. The designers mix playful elements with natural materials and rich textures, bringing in an array of influences and the voices of their design-savvy clients.With offices in Coral Gables and New York, the firm has become a go-to for adventurous homeowners and brands such as Google, Loro Piana, and Ralph Lauren. Prime Projects works on residential and commercial projects, and the firm’s offerings include custom furniture design, site planning, art direction, and project management.Adriana Hoyos Design StudioAdriana Hoyos Design Studio devised a Brickell Key apartment where elegance and sensuality intertwine, creating a harmonious space that exudes sophistication. The firm intended to create a masculine, elegant, and timeless space, using dark wood, light leather, and metallic accents. Adriana Hoyos Design Studio’s luxurious residential, hospitality, and commercial designs can be found from Quito to Qatar. Founded in 1994 by interior designer Adriana Hoyos, the firm helps translate its clients’ tastes into functional and sophisticated spaces filled with glam accents, commanding art, and elegant materials.The firm has offices in Miami and Ecuador, with Hoyos’s daughter and the firm’s creative director, Andrea Perez, leading the team in Quito. The globetrotting team finds inspiration in a project’s locale, creating interiors that speak to their settings and the unique personalities of their owners.Elizabeth Ghia InteriorsDesigner Elizabeth Ghia installed Iksel’s Italian Panoramic mural wallpaper and custom wrought iron consoles in the graceful entry of a 1926 home in Coral Gables’ Italian Village. Designer Elizabeth Ghia’s inspiring spaces bring icons of design history into the 21st century for spaces that feel fresh yet classic. Her eponymous Coral Gables–based firm takes on projects across the country and in different styles, from a traditional English kitchen in a historic New York farmhouse to a contemporary apartment on Fisher Island.Ghia is known for her exacting attention to detail and her ability to mix new pieces with vintage and antique elements to make a space look collected and personalized to the client. Elizabeth Ghia Interiors works on interior decoration, renovations, and new construction and has ample experience with landmark properties.Jaegger Interior DesignIn this Miami penthouse by Jaegger Interior Design, the dining room boasts a sleek light oak and brass table complemented by ten Sergio Rodrigues chairs. Adjacent, a piece by the late kinetic master Carlos Cruz-Diez adds an extra layer of artistic allure. Denilson MachadoBorn and raised in Rio de Janeiro, Jessica Jaegger brings a deep understanding of rich Brazil’s design history to her firm, Jaegger Interior Design. Warm woods, custom millwork, sculptural furnishings, and beautifully displayed art are all hallmarks of the firm’s work throughout the Miami area.Jaegger and her team devise elevated, modern spaces that fit the lifestyles of their clients, adding features such as home workspaces, party-ready dining rooms, and walk-in wine cellars. Exquisite materials are beautifully showcased throughout Jaegger’s designs, from walnut wall paneling and marble tables to porcelain floors.Assure InteriorsAssure Interiors planned this space in response to the client's favorite art and antique pieces. Mark RoskamsFounded in 2000 by Carola Pimentel, Assure Interiors uses soothing color palettes, organic elements, and subtle textures to evoke the indoor-outdoor lifestyle of Florida, California, and Brazil. The passions and collections of the firm’s clients are given pride of place in the design, and Pimentel brings in a curated selection of pieces from established and up-and-coming American and international dealers.Assure Interiors gravitates towards timeless materials such as walnut, terrazzo, white oak, and natural stone, and custom cabinetry and furnishings, including unique acrylic accents, complete the firm’s spaces. From historic houses to contemporary buildings by famed architects such as Rem Koolhaas, Pimentel and her team are able to bring their fresh and breezy sensibility to any style of home.Tamara Feldman DesignTamara Feldman blended minimalist elements such as Luminaire sconces and a custom headboard with a monochromatic palette to create an oasis of tranquility in a Miami home. With her knack for creating impactful spaces that perfectly complement contemporary art, it’s no wonder that designer Tamara Feldman has become a go-to for Miami’s major collectors. The designer takes inspiration from her native Mexico City and her time spent studying in Japan, bringing the outdoors in and incorporating organic elements with a contemporary twist.Her firm, Tamara Feldman Design, takes on residential and commercial commissions and collaborates closely with clients to bring their cultures and personal histories into the design. The firm’s considered and detail-driven approach is evident from the first meeting, and the team brings an adventurous spirit to the design process.Dunagan Diverio Design GroupFor this tropical modern home, Dunagan Diverio Design Group used warm woods, liquid metal finishes, and limestone flooring to contrast against the white cabinetry and stylish appliances, creating a welcoming kitchen. Founder Charlotte Dunagan and partner Thomas Diverio each bring their unique skill sets and backgrounds to their firm, Dunagan Diverio Design Group. Dunagan grew up steeped in design, while Diverio adds an architectural perspective. Together with their team, the designers have become known for their attention to detail and ability to seamlessly integrate the interior and exterior of a home.Specializing in high-end residential projects, Dunagan Diverio Design Group works on projects across the country in a range of styles from traditional to ultra contemporary, incorporating show-stopping features such as cavernous wine cellars, elegant home theaters, and clubby billiard rooms.Escala FormaEscala Forma designed this dining room to feel like a luxurious oasis, showcasing a grand live-edge wood table, capiz shell chandeliers, and white leather woven chairs for a blend of lightness and texture. Nestled in the room's rear is an eclectic breakfast nook with checkered black and white floor tiles, Cole & Son wallpaper, custom millwork, and a green velvet banquet. Miami’s signature glitz and glam infuse the eye-catching spaces by Escala Forma, an international interior design studio founded by Carlos Rodriguez. The maximalist designer incorporates dazzling lighting, bold prints, and plenty of metallic accents into his residential designs and his commercial projects, which include local hotspots The Savoy and Queen Miami Beach.Rodriguez beautifully incorporates his signature style into historic settings, adding nods to the space’s location and heritage into the design. The firm’s spaces are bold yet extremely livable, and each interior showcases his clients’ passions, whether it’s art, music, fashion, or entertaining.James DuncanFor their author and art collector clients, James and Miriam Duncan designed an airy, pale blue Miami kitchen filled with books and art while also taking advantage of the tropical garden surrounding it. Designers James and Miriam Duncan bring a well-traveled aesthetic to their Miami firm, James Duncan. The studio designs in a variety of styles, from eclectic beachfront bungalows to sleek, art-filled high-rise apartments, incorporating elements that give each space a sense of place.In addition to interior design, James Duncan offers interior architecture services and customizes projects with custom murals, wallpaper, millwork, and furnishings. The firm works extensively in Miami and New York and has deep connections to talented collaborators, including architects, landscape designers, and contractors.Hinojosa DesignIn the dining room of a Surfside apartment designed by Hino Studio, a Joseph Jeup marble table is surrounded by white leather Holly Hunt chairs. Custom Italian millwork with LED lights was installed across the ceiling. Sabrina Maclean, lead designer of Hinojosa Design, carries on the stylish legacy of her mother, Carola Hinojosa, who founded the firm in 2000. Maclean puts an emphasis on sustainability and wellness in her designs, creating spaces that enhance her clients’ wellbeing.Working with residential and commercial clients, Hino Studio devises spaces that feel airy and modern, incorporating tranquil color palettes, lush textures, and natural materials. The firm isn’t afraid to add dramatic touches such as bold accent walls and sculptural lighting.Brown Davis Architecture and InteriorsA pair of 1960s Mazzega Murano pendants illuminate a table designed by Brown Davis for Keith Fritz Fine Furniture in a Miami Beach dining area. Kris TamburelloTodd Davis and Rob Brown have designed spaces for a who’s who of power players, including the British Embassy residence and two homes for President and Secretary of State Clinton. Since joining forces in 1994, the duo has become known for their ability to blend classical and modern architecture and design, creating interiors that are fresh yet refined.The firm incorporates striking one-of-a-kind elements, from sculptural staircases to elegant colored-wood furnishings. Offering architectural, interior, and landscape design, Brown Davis lends its exacting eye to all aspects of a project to create homes that feel cohesive, indoors and out.Lauren Jayne DesignWith garden views and a harmonious assemblage of vintage and contemporary pieces, Lauren Jayne Design created an airy and quiet refuge in this Brooklyn living room. Devon BanksAfter earning her stripes working for Victoria Hagan, MarkZeff and Meyer Davis, designer Lauren Williams founded her studio, Lauren Jayne Design, bringing over 20 years of experience in residential and hospitality design. Curvaceous furnishings, neutral hues and natural materials feature prominently in the firm’s creations.Williams has worked on everything from hotspots in Miami, Vegas, and New York to tailored residences in Aspen, Brooklyn, and South Beach. Whether the project is residential or hospitality, Lauren Jayne Design brings a warm and welcoming feel to each interior it designs.Collarte InteriorsThe primary bedroom inside Collarte Interiors’ Mediterranean Villa is equal parts sophisticated and soothing and features a vintage cognac Togo sofa from Ligne Roset, a Paul Frankl cork console, a brass origami-inspired Slit Coffee Table from Hay, and an Akari light sculpture overhead. From Mediterranean-inspired villas to ocean-view penthouses, Collarte Interiors’s spaces exude a sense of calm. The firm favors neutral palettes and natural materials that patina over time, such as stone, wood, and metal, and founder Constanza Collarte is a master of the mix, blending vintage pieces and rugs with contemporary furnishings and art.Collarte Interiors specializes in residential projects, including renovations and large-scale new builds. Collarte and her team lend their soothing aesthetic to spaces from the beach to the mountains and tailor their interiors to the homes’ surroundings.DLT InteriorsA light, bright living area designed by DLT Interiors features appealing shades of neutrals and plenty of supple textures. John NeitzelYou can practically feel the ocean breeze upon stepping into a home designed by DLT Interiors. Founded by Debbie Lori Travin, the firm puts a modern twist on classic style, designing fresh, comfortable spaces from Miami to the Hamptons.Blue and white palettes, pale woods, and woven textures are through lines in the firm’s work, and Travin favors timeless styles over current trends. DLT Interiors guides clients through each step of the design process and efficiently manages all aspects of the project, from floor plans to white glove installation.Guidon StudioGuidon Studio embraced the allure of Miami's skyline and ocean vistas when creating this stunning living room oasis. It showcases a kitchen with natural stone and darker materials that serve as a backdrop for the unique furniture layout and distinctive light fixtures. Thanks to his background in production engineering and interior design, Guidon Studio's head designer, Max Guidon, takes an analytical and precise approach to projects. The firm specializes in high-end residential design, bringing in inspiration from around the world, bold forms, and striking color palettes.Founded in 2019, Guidon Studio has become known for crafting innovative interiors that balance functionality and originality, playing with volume, texture, and light. Guidon and his team provide a comprehensive range of services from schematic design to construction administration to art consulting.Studio J & CoThis fresh, white great room by Studio J & Co. welcomes guests with a hospitality feel and serves as a neutral backdrop to a deep blue lap pool and extravagant landscape. The 15,000-square-foot estate shares a mix of deep wood tones and coral stone with floor to ceiling windows and sliding doors bringing the outside in. Jennifer Fitzpatrick brings years of hospitality design experience and an ability to handle complex and large-scale projects to her firm, Studio J & Co. With offices in Miami Beach and New York, the firm tackles residential, hospitality, and commercial projects of all sizes from single-space transformations to complete renovations.Studio J & Co. works in a range of styles and is not afraid to add unexpected elements, from charming wallpapers to dramatic stone walls. Fitzpatrick and her team tailor their services to the needs of the client, offering everything from interior architecture and staging to graphics and branding.Sam RobinSam Robin created a sleek seating area that takes full advantage of the spectacular views from a condo on Fisher Island. With offices in Miami and Lago Bracciano, Italy, designer Sam Robin brings a worldly perspective to her projects, which include residences, hotels, restaurants, and even private planes. Robin established her eponymous boutique design firm in 1990, and the firm has worked on projects across the globe, including Italy, Monaco, Mexico, and Brazil.Bespoke elements play a major role in the firm’s interiors, and the designer and her team incorporate pieces that are as functional as they are elegant. Robin has also collaborated with Francesco Caracciolo di Marano on Robicara, a collection of custom furniture and accessories.AGSIAFor a gallery-style apartment project in Aventura, AGSIA styled the space with furniture that complements the main attraction: the art. Founded in 2008 as a melding of their architecture and interior design backgrounds, Adriana Grauer and Alanna Kleiner have carved out a space in Miami for AGSIA's all-encompassing style. The firm finds inspiration in the founders’ European and Latin American roots, alongside natural elements and individual clients' needs. The resulting projects encompass lake houses, workplaces, and modernist homes.With a distinctly art-forward touch, the AGSIA team envisions spaces that are colorful, functional and fun.C.A.D InternationalStaircase from one of C.A.D International's private residence projects in Sagaponach, New York. Charles Allem’s titular design studio is rooted in his native Johannesburg, South Africa, though his work has brought him to London, Hong Kong, New York—where he has a satellite office—and Miami, which he operates out of today. C.A.D International has brought boutique refinement and professionalism to interiors for over 20 years. The process begins with Allem’s quest to understand his client’s needs inside out, before his team of expert designers, draftsmen, architects, and project managers carry out a vision informed by both formal and functional factors.The results encompass private residences in the Hamptons, New York City, and Los Angeles, hospitality projects in Hong Kong, and spas in Miami. Standout luxury commercial projects include luxury condominium developments such as the Bristol Palm Beach, and the Regalia in Sunny Isles.Studio RodaIn this sunny living room, Studio Roda carved out a charming seating niche, which they flanked with globular sconces. By keeping the furniture inviting but hushed, the studio allows the “wow” elements—like a bold ikat rug and colorful artwork—to do the talking. Jeanne CantoExperts in residential and commercial interiors, Studio Roda embraces eclecticism in their highly personalized, surprising spaces. Delight sits around every corner—whether it’s a slick, mirrored partition, a cool copper kitchen island, or a tucked-in niche for lounging.Founder Rodrigo Albir, an interior architect, has collaborated with well-known firms like Yabu Pushelberg and Studio Sofield. His admiration of wide-ranging luminaries like Donald Judd, Yves Saint Laurent, and Louis Kahn, as well as movements like midcentury modernism and French Art Deco means that the spaces he crafts are informed by history and a well-honed eye.FL InteriorsFor this residence at the Estates at Acqualina, FL Interiors employed a modern, coastal aesthetic to lend the living space a relaxing air. An ample sectional is surrounded by low tables, sculptural lighting, and luxury finishes, and a well-appointed outdoor area sits adjacent. Kris Tamburello courtesy of FL InteriorsHaving worked in some of Miami’s hottest and most high-end developments, like Armani Residences at the Estates at Acqualina, FL Interiors is in touch with what luxury clients want: Elegant, elevated finishes and furnishings as well as comfortable and hospitable layouts that jive with the lifestyles of their A-list clientele.Creative directors Jorge Fuentes and Adriana Lacruz work across residential, commercial, and hospitality programs, and their team is able to oversee interior architecture and design, decoration, styling, and custom millwork. The pair have projects in progress across the Miami area, from Coral Gables to Sunny Isles, Brickell, and beyond.Bunsa StudioFor this beach house in Ponte Vedra Beach, Florida, Bunsa Studio added cypress paneling and a commissioned Bojagi-style curtain by Adam Pogue to a study off the primary bedroom. Nicole Franzen courtesy of Bunsa StudioFounded in 2013 by Jennifer Bunsa, this studio’s objective is to create a unique sense of place that is thoughtful, comfortable, and infused with soul. At the heart of the practice is a love of color, pattern, texture, and a strong desire to create spaces that feel lived-in and timeless. Bunsa Studio believes that the creation of soulful design comes from attention to detail, the incorporation of natural and hand-made materials, and blending the old with the new.Born and raised in Miami, Bunsa’s love of design, history, and color was inspired from an early age by the city’s diverse culture and iconic architecture. She began her pursuit of design while studying color theory under Bernard Voichysonk (an understudy of Josef Albers during his time at Yale) at the University of Florida, and also studied Architectural Theory under Caroline Constant, who at the time was researching and writing her book on design icon Eileen Gray. The exposure to this research ignited Bunsa’s passion for and pursuit of knowledge for the decorative arts, which plays a crucial role in her work today.Get AD-ApprovedJoin the AD PRO Directory, our professional network that puts you in front of the right clients. Learn moreArrowLight On WhiteWith sweeping 360-degree views of Miami, this full-floor unit in a prominent luxury condominium tower presented a blank canvas for Light On White to transform into a warm and sophisticated home. Kris Tamburello courtesy of Light on WhiteUnder the direction of Alizee Brion, design studio Light On White pursues a delicate balance between luxury and simplicity, striving to bring a curated modern elegance and innovative design to residential spaces. Light and natural materials take precedence in all of the studio’s projects, which are each filtered through the unique lens of client and context.The Light On White design aesthetic celebrates nature’s inspirations in a search for harmony, simplicity, and raw beauty. The team draws from cultural and aesthetic influences spanning across the world, with a focus on French, Japanese, and Scandinavian design. Their work frequently incorporates significant vintage and contemporary collectible design pieces, and strives for a fluidity between the architecture and the furnishings.Antrobus Design CollectiveTo complement the architecture of Zaha Hadid’s One Thousand Museum tower, Antrobus Design Collective took a sophisticated tonal approach in this residence, using carved shapes as accents. Barry Grossman courtesy of Antrobus Design CollectiveAntrobus Design Collective is an award-winning, multidisciplinary interior design firm specializing in luxury residential and boutique hospitality projects, as well as unique product collaborations. Founding principal Alison Antrobus’s leadership and creative vision are responsible for driving some of the highest-record property sales in Florida history.Artfully blending her Caribbean heritage, her professional journey with design icons, and the eclectic culture of Miami, Antrobus has mastered what she calls “creative storytelling” to deliver one-of-a-kind properties that exude warmth, character, and soul. Drawing inspiration from each client’s perspective and guiding vision, her design firm is able to offer diversity in design styles while translating each project through its own unique creative lens.Britto CharetteBritto Charette introduced wood and metal to the minimalist interiors of this seven-bedroom residence in the Hamptons to warm up its expansive spaces. Alexia Fodere courtesy of Britto CharetteBritto Charette is a licensed and award-winning interior design firm specializing in ultraluxury residential interiors. Operating from New York City and a studio in Wynwood, Miami, founders Jay Britto and David Charette work with a multilingual design team to create custom furniture, accessories, and turnkey interiors for a global clientele. Inspired by travel, fashion, art, and emerging technologies, the team has completed interiors internationally and in many of South Florida’s most coveted buildings.Britto Charette works with some of the industry’s most talented craftspeople and vendors to offer its clients full-spectrum interior design services, including conceptualization, space planning, furniture selection, renderings, and in-house 3D printing/modeling.Bea Interiors DesignIn this Aventura residence, Bea Interiors Design added texture to the light-colored palette using bouclé furniture. Gabriel Volpi courtesy of Bea Interiors DesignFor more than a decade, Bea Interiors Design has offered a full range of services including conceptual design, custom furniture and finishes, project coordination, art procurement and installation, and lighting and furniture design. Founder Bea Pernia is intimately involved in each of her projects from ideation to completion, collaborating with clients, architects, artisans, and contractors to craft meaningful solutions—always with precision, flexibility, attention to detail, and genuine passion.Pernia expertly applies her artistic sensibility to craft novel, harmonious aesthetics that follow her passion for interior and product design. Viewing each project as a unique opportunity to explore fabrics, textures, contrasts, shapes, and materials in order to realize the vision of her client, she often experiments with natural woods, lush textiles, leather, metal, and reflective surfaces. The outcome infuses natural elements with timeless elegance for a look that is at once clean and modern.Studio IDCThe great room of a beach estate on the private island of Jumby Bay, off the coast of Antigua, was designed by Studio IDC to blend seamlessly with its location. Michael Stavaridis courtesy of Studio IDCStudio IDC is a boutique, second-generation, family-owned interior design firm offering turnkey services to luxury residential and hospitality clientele throughout South Florida and the Caribbean. Drawing on cultural influences, locality, and client lifestyles, Studio IDC aims to curate visually exquisite and functional spaces. The firm’s licensed designers and in-house procurement specialists are attuned to each client’s bespoke needs, ensuring smooth communication throughout the design process.Celebrating its 25th year in business, Studio IDC originated on the fundamental belief that successful interior design is the product of tailored and collaborative synergy. Led by chief designer Todd Tyler's passion for stunning, experiential design, the studio’s goal is to form lasting relationships with clients, vendors, and partners equally inspired by seamless spaces—whether it’s their holiday home or a five-star hotel project.B+G DesignThe founders of B+G Design created the interiors for their own home at Ten Museum Park, which recently featured in a Maluma music video. Kris Tamburello courtesy of B+G DesignFounded by Brett and Giselle Sugerman, B+G Design is an award-winning, Miami-based interior design firm recognized for combining functional minimalism with a warm contemporary appeal. From its home base in Miami to projects in New York, DC, Aspen, Los Angeles, and abroad, the team’s modern and elevated designs blend clean lines with luxe finishes, natural materials, and pared-down color palettes.Between the founders, Giselle brings an emotional and wellness connection to their projects, while Brett’s elevated architectural knowledge and deep understanding of the design process—from construction and documentation to build-out and installation—delivers their clients a sense of trust, knowing projects have a 360-degree approach to design.Mr Alex Tate DesignIn this dining room at a Coconut Grove residence, Alex Alonso of Mr Alex Tate Design mixed his clients’ heirloom pieces with contemporary furniture to give the space an eclectic vibe. Juan Pablo Castro courtesy of Mr Alex TateFor Mr Alex Tate Design, every project is a unique opportunity to curate fearlessly, and to collaborate with clients to create lasting spaces that linger on the design consciousness. A constant process of editing is at the core of the studio's expertise. Its current portfolio of work spans across the country, with major interior design projects in Miami, LA, Boston, Palm Beach, the Caribbean, and further abroad.The studio team of Miami interior designers is led by design principal Alex Alonso, who is a maximalist at heart. After years working in media and entertainment on both coasts and traveling abroad, he launched a studio that embraces a global perspective and celebrates the power of storytelling through spaces. Reflecting a distinct design approach that is all about eclecticism, the result is a bold sensibility he calls “modern American maximalism.”Are you looking for an interior decorator or designer to hire for your next project? Wherever you are, visit the AD PRO Directory to browse our list of AD-approved designers and find your match for a design consultation
html:
With Magic City in the midst of a real estate boom, it’s no shock that Miami interior designers are currently in such high demand. As buyers flocked to sunny South Florida shores during and following the pandemic lockdowns, prices in the metropolis soared—and the need for designers swiftly followed. Luckily, the city is already home to a wealth of creative talent who can adeptly cater to high-end clientele and know exactly how to design for Miami’s famed tropical climate. Drawing on its rich Art Deco history, myriad Latin American influences, and the latest interiors trends, these AD PRO Directory–listed designers can offer clients elevated beach villas that embrace indoor-outdoor living, sleek minimalist residences in the city’s many starchitect-designed towers, and much more.

Love Lake Studio

Whether designing Miami beach bungalows or Manhattan hotspots, Love Lake Studio knows how to blend a wide range of influences into one-of-a-kind spaces. The Miami-based interior architecture and design studio brings an artful, luxury-filled approach to residential and commercial projects around the world. Led by founder and principal Genevieve Lake, the team’s impactful interiors have garnered them a client list made up entirely of referrals and repeat clients.

Rose Ink Workshop

Designer Liubasha Rose earned her stripes designing high-profile hotels and restaurants. She brings this hospitality experience to her Miami Beach– and New York–based firm, Rose Ink Workshop. Rose and her team, who boast backgrounds in art, fashion, interiors, and branding, focus on designing spaces that tell a story. They apply this narrative-driven style to residential and hospitality projects across the globe, from estates on Miami’s exclusive Star Island to country homes in New York.

Wecselman Design

After a dozen years designing stores for Ralph Lauren, Deborah Wecselman brought together a talented team of architects and designers in founding her eponymous firm in Miami. Now, Wecselman Design specializes in high-end residential interiors, drawing inspiration from a wide variety of sources, including ocean views and sleek art galleries. Neutral palettes allow colorful artwork, architectural elements, and panoramic views to take center stage.

Studio 790 Interior Design

By mixing vivid colors and eye-catching patterns, Studio 790 Interior Design creates contemporary spaces filled with personality. Founded by Ann Lopez, who brings over 20 years of luxury hospitality design experience, the studio brings fun and functionality to everything from residential projects to large-scale commercial designs. With hundreds of completed spaces under their belts, Lopez and her all-female team work in a wide range of styles, from coastal to boho.

Luxury Living by Ania Agárdy

Through her design portfolio, Ania Agárdy argues sophistication is about detail. Her Miami interior design firm brings refinement and modern elegance to projects from New York to Latin America. The designer’s multicultural background and world travels influence her high-end yet functional spaces, which feature a mix of styles and decor sourced from across the globe. In addition to residential projects, the firm also lends its expert eye to yacht designs and art curation.

Sanchez Coleman Studio

In 2017, interior designer Christopher Coleman combined forces with Venezuelan architect and fashion designer Angel Sanchez to form Sanchez Coleman Studio, a combination of their unique perspectives and wealth of experience. Art frequently takes center stage in the high-end firm’s modern designs, and the team doesn’t shy away from old bold elements either. Whether it's with whimsical banana-print wallpaper or dramatic color palettes, the Miami-based firm adds contemporary flair to everything from private residences to hotels to developments.

2id Interiors

Design is imbued with particular a sense of comfort and urban ease in the work of 2id Interiors. Led by founders Rafaela Simoes and Laila Colvin, the Miami studio works on residential and commercial projects across South Florida and around the world. Ocean or city views often serve as a focal point in the firm’s spaces, which feature sleek surfaces, sculptural lighting, neutral palettes, and plenty of bespoke details while maintaining a familial vibe.

Carolina Design

The work of designer Carolina Freyre teems with old-world inspiration. Her Coral Gables–based firm, Carolina Design, is known for its relaxed yet refined interiors, which range in style from modern farmhouse to Tuscan-inspired. Freyre draws on her background working at the Miami Art Museum to give her spaces a curated feel that invigorates the senses. The designer excels at crafting rooms to delight every member of the family, from charming bunk rooms to captivating closets.

Ricardo Barroso and Associates

With offices in Miami, Mexico City, and Madrid, Ricardo Barroso and Associates brings a global perspective to its high-end residential, commercial, and hospitality design projects. Founded in 1999 by architect, interior designer, and artist Ricardo Barroso, the international design studio boasts a team of skilled contractors and craftsmen who help execute and elevate their designs. The Miami office works on South Florida homes of all sizes and also brings its polished, luxe aesthetic to yachts.

Janet Patterson Interior Design

Designer Janet Patterson knows how to create interiors that speak to her client and their lifestyles, whether they require a bold bachelor pad or a cozy cottage. Her namesake firm specializes in new construction and large-scale renovations that enhance their owners’ wellbeing. JPID offers full-service interior design, including comprehensive turnkey projects, as well as e-design services for smaller projects and spaces.

Errez Design

Founded by Ruben and Katie Gutierrez in 2009, Errez Design brings a big dose of personality to their residential and commercial projects. To this day, the husband-and-wife team are known for fearlessly incorporating vivid colors and dazzling patterns to create a Miami maximalist aesthetic. The firm’s “biographical design” process also ensures that all finished products are functional—and meaningful—for the client. Errez Design has completed 100 projects in Florida and around the world, each showcasing its signature lively, livable style.

Design Solutions

Led by founder Luciana Fragali, Miami interiors firm Design Solutions captures the city’s coolness through its elevated residential projects. For over 19 years, the firm has been transforming homes into modern masterpieces with exquisite materials, sculptural furnishings, and blue-chip art. Fragali and her team offer white-glove, turnkey service and call on a trusted roster of vendors and craftspeople to ensure that the end product meets its high standards.

Moniomi Design

Unexpected details and playful elements are through lines in the work of Moniomi Design. Led by husband-and-wife team Ronald Alvarez and Monica Santayana, the firm is known for the fun, eclectic style it incorporates into residential and commercial projects, which range from Upper West Side apartments to Wynwood office spaces. Its product line, Made by Moniomi, includes a creative assortment of furnishings, from Ping-Pong tables to luxe mini basketball hoops.

Sensi Casa Design Studio

Natural materials, soft textures, and neutral palettes lend the interiors by Sensi Casa Design Studio a feeling of tranquility and comfort. Led by Chiara Sensi Contugi and Diego Guarderas, the Pinecrest-based firm partners with clients to transform their homes into showpieces, and also helps with home staging and furniture rentals, as well as collaborating on luxury new builds. Sensi Contugi and Guarderas draw inspiration from their Italian heritage, incorporating nods to old world and contemporary European style.

Margarita Bravo

Deftly working across a wide range of styles, from coastal minimalism to contemporary glamour, designer Margarita Bravo helps clients create homes that are personally reflective. Bravo and her team design projects around the world, offering full-service design solutions, space planning, custom furniture design, and art curation from locations in Denver, Miami, Montecito, Aspen, and Barcelona. Drawing inspiration from Latin American and European design, the firm expertly balances livability and beauty in its residential and commercial projects.

Marcela Cure Studio

Designer Marcela Cure brings an artist’s eye to her interiors. Operating from Miami, Delaware, and Colombia, Marcela Cure Studio takes a curatorial approach to its residential and boutique commercial interiors in the United States and Latin America, blending sculptural forms with playful punches of personality. The firm’s layered spaces are enhanced by an elegant mix of natural materials, artisanal objects, and custom furnishings, giving each home a one-of-a-kind feel.

Poggi Design

Creative collaboration is at the heart of Poggi Design’s process. Led by Juan Poggi, the Coral Gables–based firm considers everyone involved in a project—including clients, contractors, and architects—an integral part of the team. The designer finds inspiration in his travels across the globe and brings his discoveries into the modern spaces he creates in Miami and beyond.

Poggi Design is particularly adept at devising interiors that showcase spectacular art collections in spaces that feel warm and welcoming. Poggi captures the spirit of each project before he begins designing and creates a unique piece for every home the firm works on. In addition to the firm’s residential work, they offer a collection of sleek seating and lighting.

Prime Projects

Led by principals Jovanna Joseph and Brendan Mahoney, Prime Projects is known for playing with dramatic contrasts to create memorable spaces, from a burnt orange office kitchen to a high-rise apartment filled with colorful accents. The designers mix playful elements with natural materials and rich textures, bringing in an array of influences and the voices of their design-savvy clients.

With offices in Coral Gables and New York, the firm has become a go-to for adventurous homeowners and brands such as Google, Loro Piana, and Ralph Lauren. Prime Projects works on residential and commercial projects, and the firm’s offerings include custom furniture design, site planning, art direction, and project management.

Adriana Hoyos Design Studio

Adriana Hoyos Design Studio’s luxurious residential, hospitality, and commercial designs can be found from Quito to Qatar. Founded in 1994 by interior designer Adriana Hoyos, the firm helps translate its clients’ tastes into functional and sophisticated spaces filled with glam accents, commanding art, and elegant materials.

The firm has offices in Miami and Ecuador, with Hoyos’s daughter and the firm’s creative director, Andrea Perez, leading the team in Quito. The globetrotting team finds inspiration in a project’s locale, creating interiors that speak to their settings and the unique personalities of their owners.

Elizabeth Ghia Interiors

Designer Elizabeth Ghia’s inspiring spaces bring icons of design history into the 21st century for spaces that feel fresh yet classic. Her eponymous Coral Gables–based firm takes on projects across the country and in different styles, from a traditional English kitchen in a historic New York farmhouse to a contemporary apartment on Fisher Island.

Ghia is known for her exacting attention to detail and her ability to mix new pieces with vintage and antique elements to make a space look collected and personalized to the client. Elizabeth Ghia Interiors works on interior decoration, renovations, and new construction and has ample experience with landmark properties.

Jaegger Interior Design

Born and raised in Rio de Janeiro, Jessica Jaegger brings a deep understanding of rich Brazil’s design history to her firm, Jaegger Interior Design. Warm woods, custom millwork, sculptural furnishings, and beautifully displayed art are all hallmarks of the firm’s work throughout the Miami area.

Jaegger and her team devise elevated, modern spaces that fit the lifestyles of their clients, adding features such as home workspaces, party-ready dining rooms, and walk-in wine cellars. Exquisite materials are beautifully showcased throughout Jaegger’s designs, from walnut wall paneling and marble tables to porcelain floors.

Assure Interiors

Founded in 2000 by Carola Pimentel, Assure Interiors uses soothing color palettes, organic elements, and subtle textures to evoke the indoor-outdoor lifestyle of Florida, California, and Brazil. The passions and collections of the firm’s clients are given pride of place in the design, and Pimentel brings in a curated selection of pieces from established and up-and-coming American and international dealers.

Assure Interiors gravitates towards timeless materials such as walnut, terrazzo, white oak, and natural stone, and custom cabinetry and furnishings, including unique acrylic accents, complete the firm’s spaces. From historic houses to contemporary buildings by famed architects such as Rem Koolhaas, Pimentel and her team are able to bring their fresh and breezy sensibility to any style of home.

Tamara Feldman Design

With her knack for creating impactful spaces that perfectly complement contemporary art, it’s no wonder that designer Tamara Feldman has become a go-to for Miami’s major collectors. The designer takes inspiration from her native Mexico City and her time spent studying in Japan, bringing the outdoors in and incorporating organic elements with a contemporary twist.

Her firm, Tamara Feldman Design, takes on residential and commercial commissions and collaborates closely with clients to bring their cultures and personal histories into the design. The firm’s considered and detail-driven approach is evident from the first meeting, and the team brings an adventurous spirit to the design process.

Dunagan Diverio Design Group

Founder Charlotte Dunagan and partner Thomas Diverio each bring their unique skill sets and backgrounds to their firm, Dunagan Diverio Design Group. Dunagan grew up steeped in design, while Diverio adds an architectural perspective. Together with their team, the designers have become known for their attention to detail and ability to seamlessly integrate the interior and exterior of a home.

Specializing in high-end residential projects, Dunagan Diverio Design Group works on projects across the country in a range of styles from traditional to ultra contemporary, incorporating show-stopping features such as cavernous wine cellars, elegant home theaters, and clubby billiard rooms.

Escala Forma

Miami’s signature glitz and glam infuse the eye-catching spaces by Escala Forma, an international interior design studio founded by Carlos Rodriguez. The maximalist designer incorporates dazzling lighting, bold prints, and plenty of metallic accents into his residential designs and his commercial projects, which include local hotspots The Savoy and Queen Miami Beach.

Rodriguez beautifully incorporates his signature style into historic settings, adding nods to the space’s location and heritage into the design. The firm’s spaces are bold yet extremely livable, and each interior showcases his clients’ passions, whether it’s art, music, fashion, or entertaining.

James Duncan

Designers James and Miriam Duncan bring a well-traveled aesthetic to their Miami firm, James Duncan. The studio designs in a variety of styles, from eclectic beachfront bungalows to sleek, art-filled high-rise apartments, incorporating elements that give each space a sense of place.

In addition to interior design, James Duncan offers interior architecture services and customizes projects with custom murals, wallpaper, millwork, and furnishings. The firm works extensively in Miami and New York and has deep connections to talented collaborators, including architects, landscape designers, and contractors.

Hinojosa Design

Sabrina Maclean, lead designer of Hinojosa Design, carries on the stylish legacy of her mother, Carola Hinojosa, who founded the firm in 2000. Maclean puts an emphasis on sustainability and wellness in her designs, creating spaces that enhance her clients’ wellbeing.

Working with residential and commercial clients, Hino Studio devises spaces that feel airy and modern, incorporating tranquil color palettes, lush textures, and natural materials. The firm isn’t afraid to add dramatic touches such as bold accent walls and sculptural lighting.

Brown Davis Architecture and Interiors

Todd Davis and Rob Brown have designed spaces for a who’s who of power players, including the British Embassy residence and two homes for President and Secretary of State Clinton. Since joining forces in 1994, the duo has become known for their ability to blend classical and modern architecture and design, creating interiors that are fresh yet refined.

The firm incorporates striking one-of-a-kind elements, from sculptural staircases to elegant colored-wood furnishings. Offering architectural, interior, and landscape design, Brown Davis lends its exacting eye to all aspects of a project to create homes that feel cohesive, indoors and out.

Lauren Jayne Design

After earning her stripes working for Victoria Hagan, MarkZeff and Meyer Davis, designer Lauren Williams founded her studio, Lauren Jayne Design, bringing over 20 years of experience in residential and hospitality design. Curvaceous furnishings, neutral hues and natural materials feature prominently in the firm’s creations.

Williams has worked on everything from hotspots in Miami, Vegas, and New York to tailored residences in Aspen, Brooklyn, and South Beach. Whether the project is residential or hospitality, Lauren Jayne Design brings a warm and welcoming feel to each interior it designs.

Collarte Interiors

From Mediterranean-inspired villas to ocean-view penthouses, Collarte Interiors’s spaces exude a sense of calm. The firm favors neutral palettes and natural materials that patina over time, such as stone, wood, and metal, and founder Constanza Collarte is a master of the mix, blending vintage pieces and rugs with contemporary furnishings and art.

Collarte Interiors specializes in residential projects, including renovations and large-scale new builds. Collarte and her team lend their soothing aesthetic to spaces from the beach to the mountains and tailor their interiors to the homes’ surroundings.

DLT Interiors

You can practically feel the ocean breeze upon stepping into a home designed by DLT Interiors. Founded by Debbie Lori Travin, the firm puts a modern twist on classic style, designing fresh, comfortable spaces from Miami to the Hamptons.

Blue and white palettes, pale woods, and woven textures are through lines in the firm’s work, and Travin favors timeless styles over current trends. DLT Interiors guides clients through each step of the design process and efficiently manages all aspects of the project, from floor plans to white glove installation.

Guidon Studio

Thanks to his background in production engineering and interior design, Guidon Studio's head designer, Max Guidon, takes an analytical and precise approach to projects. The firm specializes in high-end residential design, bringing in inspiration from around the world, bold forms, and striking color palettes.

Founded in 2019, Guidon Studio has become known for crafting innovative interiors that balance functionality and originality, playing with volume, texture, and light. Guidon and his team provide a comprehensive range of services from schematic design to construction administration to art consulting.

Studio J & Co

Jennifer Fitzpatrick brings years of hospitality design experience and an ability to handle complex and large-scale projects to her firm, Studio J & Co. With offices in Miami Beach and New York, the firm tackles residential, hospitality, and commercial projects of all sizes from single-space transformations to complete renovations.

Studio J & Co. works in a range of styles and is not afraid to add unexpected elements, from charming wallpapers to dramatic stone walls. Fitzpatrick and her team tailor their services to the needs of the client, offering everything from interior architecture and staging to graphics and branding.

Sam Robin

With offices in Miami and Lago Bracciano, Italy, designer Sam Robin brings a worldly perspective to her projects, which include residences, hotels, restaurants, and even private planes. Robin established her eponymous boutique design firm in 1990, and the firm has worked on projects across the globe, including Italy, Monaco, Mexico, and Brazil.

Bespoke elements play a major role in the firm’s interiors, and the designer and her team incorporate pieces that are as functional as they are elegant. Robin has also collaborated with Francesco Caracciolo di Marano on Robicara, a collection of custom furniture and accessories.

AGSIA

Founded in 2008 as a melding of their architecture and interior design backgrounds, Adriana Grauer and Alanna Kleiner have carved out a space in Miami for AGSIA's all-encompassing style. The firm finds inspiration in the founders’ European and Latin American roots, alongside natural elements and individual clients' needs. The resulting projects encompass lake houses, workplaces, and modernist homes.

With a distinctly art-forward touch, the AGSIA team envisions spaces that are colorful, functional and fun.

C.A.D International

Charles Allem’s titular design studio is rooted in his native Johannesburg, South Africa, though his work has brought him to London, Hong Kong, New York—where he has a satellite office—and Miami, which he operates out of today. C.A.D International has brought boutique refinement and professionalism to interiors for over 20 years. The process begins with Allem’s quest to understand his client’s needs inside out, before his team of expert designers, draftsmen, architects, and project managers carry out a vision informed by both formal and functional factors.

The results encompass private residences in the Hamptons, New York City, and Los Angeles, hospitality projects in Hong Kong, and spas in Miami. Standout luxury commercial projects include luxury condominium developments such as the Bristol Palm Beach, and the Regalia in Sunny Isles.

Studio Roda

Experts in residential and commercial interiors, Studio Roda embraces eclecticism in their highly personalized, surprising spaces. Delight sits around every corner—whether it’s a slick, mirrored partition, a cool copper kitchen island, or a tucked-in niche for lounging.

Founder Rodrigo Albir, an interior architect, has collaborated with well-known firms like Yabu Pushelberg and Studio Sofield. His admiration of wide-ranging luminaries like Donald Judd, Yves Saint Laurent, and Louis Kahn, as well as movements like midcentury modernism and French Art Deco means that the spaces he crafts are informed by history and a well-honed eye.

FL Interiors

Having worked in some of Miami’s hottest and most high-end developments, like Armani Residences at the Estates at Acqualina, FL Interiors is in touch with what luxury clients want: Elegant, elevated finishes and furnishings as well as comfortable and hospitable layouts that jive with the lifestyles of their A-list clientele.

Creative directors Jorge Fuentes and Adriana Lacruz work across residential, commercial, and hospitality programs, and their team is able to oversee interior architecture and design, decoration, styling, and custom millwork. The pair have projects in progress across the Miami area, from Coral Gables to Sunny Isles, Brickell, and beyond.

Bunsa Studio

Founded in 2013 by Jennifer Bunsa, this studio’s objective is to create a unique sense of place that is thoughtful, comfortable, and infused with soul. At the heart of the practice is a love of color, pattern, texture, and a strong desire to create spaces that feel lived-in and timeless. Bunsa Studio believes that the creation of soulful design comes from attention to detail, the incorporation of natural and hand-made materials, and blending the old with the new.

Born and raised in Miami, Bunsa’s love of design, history, and color was inspired from an early age by the city’s diverse culture and iconic architecture. She began her pursuit of design while studying color theory under Bernard Voichysonk (an understudy of Josef Albers during his time at Yale) at the University of Florida, and also studied Architectural Theory under Caroline Constant, who at the time was researching and writing her book on design icon Eileen Gray. The exposure to this research ignited Bunsa’s passion for and pursuit of knowledge for the decorative arts, which plays a crucial role in her work today.

Get AD-Approved

Join the AD PRO Directory, our professional network that puts you in front of the right clients. Learn more

Light On White

Under the direction of Alizee Brion, design studio Light On White pursues a delicate balance between luxury and simplicity, striving to bring a curated modern elegance and innovative design to residential spaces. Light and natural materials take precedence in all of the studio’s projects, which are each filtered through the unique lens of client and context.

The Light On White design aesthetic celebrates nature’s inspirations in a search for harmony, simplicity, and raw beauty. The team draws from cultural and aesthetic influences spanning across the world, with a focus on French, Japanese, and Scandinavian design. Their work frequently incorporates significant vintage and contemporary collectible design pieces, and strives for a fluidity between the architecture and the furnishings.

Antrobus Design Collective

Antrobus Design Collective is an award-winning, multidisciplinary interior design firm specializing in luxury residential and boutique hospitality projects, as well as unique product collaborations. Founding principal Alison Antrobus’s leadership and creative vision are responsible for driving some of the highest-record property sales in Florida history.

Artfully blending her Caribbean heritage, her professional journey with design icons, and the eclectic culture of Miami, Antrobus has mastered what she calls “creative storytelling” to deliver one-of-a-kind properties that exude warmth, character, and soul. Drawing inspiration from each client’s perspective and guiding vision, her design firm is able to offer diversity in design styles while translating each project through its own unique creative lens.

Britto Charette

Britto Charette is a licensed and award-winning interior design firm specializing in ultraluxury residential interiors. Operating from New York City and a studio in Wynwood, Miami, founders Jay Britto and David Charette work with a multilingual design team to create custom furniture, accessories, and turnkey interiors for a global clientele. Inspired by travel, fashion, art, and emerging technologies, the team has completed interiors internationally and in many of South Florida’s most coveted buildings.

Britto Charette works with some of the industry’s most talented craftspeople and vendors to offer its clients full-spectrum interior design services, including conceptualization, space planning, furniture selection, renderings, and in-house 3D printing/modeling.

Bea Interiors Design

For more than a decade, Bea Interiors Design has offered a full range of services including conceptual design, custom furniture and finishes, project coordination, art procurement and installation, and lighting and furniture design. Founder Bea Pernia is intimately involved in each of her projects from ideation to completion, collaborating with clients, architects, artisans, and contractors to craft meaningful solutions—always with precision, flexibility, attention to detail, and genuine passion.

Pernia expertly applies her artistic sensibility to craft novel, harmonious aesthetics that follow her passion for interior and product design. Viewing each project as a unique opportunity to explore fabrics, textures, contrasts, shapes, and materials in order to realize the vision of her client, she often experiments with natural woods, lush textiles, leather, metal, and reflective surfaces. The outcome infuses natural elements with timeless elegance for a look that is at once clean and modern.

Studio IDC

Studio IDC is a boutique, second-generation, family-owned interior design firm offering turnkey services to luxury residential and hospitality clientele throughout South Florida and the Caribbean. Drawing on cultural influences, locality, and client lifestyles, Studio IDC aims to curate visually exquisite and functional spaces. The firm’s licensed designers and in-house procurement specialists are attuned to each client’s bespoke needs, ensuring smooth communication throughout the design process.

Celebrating its 25th year in business, Studio IDC originated on the fundamental belief that successful interior design is the product of tailored and collaborative synergy. Led by chief designer Todd Tyler's passion for stunning, experiential design, the studio’s goal is to form lasting relationships with clients, vendors, and partners equally inspired by seamless spaces—whether it’s their holiday home or a five-star hotel project.

B+G Design

Founded by Brett and Giselle Sugerman, B+G Design is an award-winning, Miami-based interior design firm recognized for combining functional minimalism with a warm contemporary appeal. From its home base in Miami to projects in New York, DC, Aspen, Los Angeles, and abroad, the team’s modern and elevated designs blend clean lines with luxe finishes, natural materials, and pared-down color palettes.

Between the founders, Giselle brings an emotional and wellness connection to their projects, while Brett’s elevated architectural knowledge and deep understanding of the design process—from construction and documentation to build-out and installation—delivers their clients a sense of trust, knowing projects have a 360-degree approach to design.

Mr Alex Tate Design

For Mr Alex Tate Design, every project is a unique opportunity to curate fearlessly, and to collaborate with clients to create lasting spaces that linger on the design consciousness. A constant process of editing is at the core of the studio's expertise. Its current portfolio of work spans across the country, with major interior design projects in Miami, LA, Boston, Palm Beach, the Caribbean, and further abroad.

The studio team of Miami interior designers is led by design principal Alex Alonso, who is a maximalist at heart. After years working in media and entertainment on both coasts and traveling abroad, he launched a studio that embraces a global perspective and celebrates the power of storytelling through spaces. Reflecting a distinct design approach that is all about eclecticism, the result is a bold sensibility he calls “modern American maximalism.”

Are you looking for an interior decorator or designer to hire for your next project? Wherever you are, visit the AD PRO Directory to browse our list of AD-approved designers and find your match for a design consultation
